Sorry, I will update as soon as possible, thanks for your review
Why report repeatedly? https://github.com/apache/skywalking/discussions/8082
Duplicate #3860. No update for a long time. Unless you are going to submit some proposal(Design doc), I think we don't plan to work on this direction.

> Duplicate #3860. No update for a long time. Unless you are going to submit some proposal(Design doc), I think we don't plan to work on this direction.

How to submit a proposal(Design doc)?I have prepared the code for this feature.

You could submit a google doc(open to people have known link) proposal to the mail list. Then PMC will review how aregenerally metadata(traffic), metrics, records(traces, logs, profiling snapshots), no streaming data(ui management and profile task) supported by Clickhouse, and whether do you have a benchmark to verify whether the design is suitable for large scale product environment.

This is a very complex and important extension. The project will accept it until the proposal and codes have been proved officially.

Take a reference from IoTDB storage option from https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/7766. It is closing to be accepted. Notice, the contributor of IoTDB storage already has guidance from the official IoTDB PMC VP. So, it is already generally easier to get approval.
Assigned to you already. This seems reasonable when face multiple versions of k8s testings, like in KubeSphere cases.

I re-write the contributing document for you, generally 2 things
1. Don't use `you could` or `you` repeatedly in the document. The document is more like an instruction, rather than command.
2. Upper case and some other grammar issues still exist, including very long sentences.

Is there anything we should add this PR? If not, please remove the `[WIP]` in the title and update changes.md in the root.

> I re-write the contributing document for you, generally 2 things
> 
> 1. Don't use `you could` or `you` repeatedly in the document. The document is more like an instruction, rather than command.
> 2. Upper case and some other grammar issues still exist, including very long sentences.

Thank you very much

Hello, @gloria-veg is this task being actively worked on? I see there's another issue waiting on this one(#5944). It will be more than fabulous if we can make it happen and release it in 1.0.0.

I see there's concrete progress on your branch, just not sure about the current status.

Hi superSky,

Thanks for your email! Yes, I am still working on this. The frame is ready but there are still some details that need to be adjusted and tested. I may not have enough time in the next two months to work on this because I am struggling to survive in the heavy workload of school courses at Georgia Tech.

I am still interested in making it happen, and if you do not mind maybe we can finish this in winter vacation! Also, you can contact my mentor Zhenxu Ke to discuss this :)

Best,

Yuanyuan

Another solution is to implement format conversion in skywalking like otel-receiver-plugin, so that using the otlp protocol for transmission, there is no need for a metriclist in a stream. But I prefer to implement the previous solution, so that if there is a large batch of data import later, this interface can be reused.

OK, so you means entity reused, right?

The metricList includes metrics from one entity?
Yes, I think it is reasonable to add. We need to review protocol first.
Is there any way you recommend? The client JS is running automatically, with one several lines added on the page, there is no clear place to tag the HTTP request.

please assign it to me!

skywalking agent v8.4.0
We only accept bug report for latest release.
And this gets disussed before, we treat IP:port as one database instance.

Hi @wu-sheng , 
What's the minimal version of Kubernetes that needs to be supported by SWCK  in the next release? 
It would be very easy to support **Kubernetes 1.19** and above only, since all the API versions are compatible. But if SWCK needs to support an older version than 1.19, we need to consider how to change the API version in the Controller and Templates.
I think this should be @hanahmily 's call. He is leading the project.

Yep, we have a plan to upgrade kube runtime by bumping up the kubebuilder v3 in **SWCK-0.5.0** which will support the latest Kubernetes. 

A canonical strategy is to release major version, for example 1.0.0, to adopt to the new APIs, backporting new feats into the old revision. But, SWCK is not production ready, have not released 1.0.0, I tend to use current major version to do update.
Hi @mis98zb , I've opened https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/8141 to address the review comments and polish the `Makefile`, can you please take a look?
Which platforms are we going to push to docker and ghcr eventually?

> Which platforms are we going to push to docker and ghcr eventually?

linux/amd64 and linux/arm64

> > Which platforms are we going to push to docker and ghcr eventually?
> 
> linux/amd64 and linux/arm64

Is this arm64 able to build on the top of a x86 Linux or Mac? (I never had a change to learn this, sorry)

> > > Which platforms are we going to push to docker and ghcr eventually?
> > 
> > 
> > linux/amd64 and linux/arm64
> 
> Is this arm64 able to build on the top of a x86 Linux or Mac? (I never had a change to learn this, sorry)

Yes, that's why we need to leverage BuildKit to build cross platform images

I end up changing the base image from `adoptopenjdk/openjdk:alpine-jre` to `adoptopenjdk/openjdk:jre`, which is closest to the previous one but supports amd64/arm64, all tests are passing, also no {high,critical} CVEs.

```
trivy --severity "HIGH,CRITICAL" adoptopenjdk/openjdk11:jre
2021-11-17T19:13:04.132+0800	INFO	Detected OS: ubuntu
2021-11-17T19:13:04.132+0800	INFO	Detecting Ubuntu vulnerabilities...
2021-11-17T19:13:04.134+0800	INFO	Number of PL dependency files: 1

adoptopenjdk/openjdk11:jre (ubuntu 20.04)
=========================================
Total: 0 (HIGH: 0, CRITICAL: 0)
```
Once it is JRE, I am fine. Just curious, what are the differences from `openjdk:alpine-jre`.

> Once it is JRE, I am fine. Just curious, what are the differences from `openjdk:alpine-jre`.

We previously use `adoptopenjdk/openjdk:alpine-jre`, which only has a `amd64` manifest in Docker image, so when building for `arm64` it cannot find the base image (for `arm64`), the difference is that `adoptopenjdk/openjdk:jre` provides both `amd64` and `arm64` manifest in Docker images so we can pull them as base image to build for both architectures.
Got this. My question is more about, what are differences of image size and components built-in inside.
Check these 2 images
Closing in favor of https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/8141
FYI @wankai123 due to you asked about this in afternoon.

We can get otel `job_name` from `node.getServiceInfo()`, then could add a tag like `job_name=skywalking` to all metrics from skywalking.
I think we can use this to do the filter.
Even we use a tag filter, we need the closure setup to filter irrelative metrics out.
yes, the metrics should filter before into MAL rules

MAL tends to generate the metrics that are mandatory. If the metrics are invalid, related MALs are redundant, having to be removed from the configuration.

What leads to such issues? Can we avoid them from the source? If their service tags are absent, could we have a chance to provide them? If not, I prefer to drop them.

No, they are not redundant. 2 kinds of agent/source(s) are generating the metrics with same name.

**oap's self-observability and vm's monitoring have the same metric name**. More importantly, this could happen again in other monitoring cases.

For making understanding easier, @hanahmily you could consider like this, MetricA from VM monitoring uses the same name SkyWalking OAP self-monitoring is using. Changing any side of these two doesn't make sense.

one more thing...  
the filter rule should consider one MAL config need multiple metrics source(otel job), like `k8s_service` require both `cAdvisor ` and `kube-state-metrics`

> the filter rule should consider one MAL config need multiple metrics source(otel job), like k8s_service require both cAdvisor and kube-state-metrics

That is why I proposed `precondition` as closure, then you could do `either` check, rather than struggling about using `at least having` or `includes`.

@liqiangz What is your progress? 

There is another update about OTEL's native metrics format, https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/pull/2104. It seems finally being stable.
And I noticed, implementation of https://github.com/apache/skywalking-data-collect-protocol/pull/56 has not been updated in OAP side. Is that coming soon?

@kezhenxu94 @JaredTan95 @dmsolr Could you check this PR carefully? I think this would be the biggest PR in this iteration.
We should be careful. Although all E2E tests passed, I would recommend to verify this PR locally and check visualize on UI manually, at least this time.

@jiangguilong2000 
Maybe you could try using OpenTelemetry to collect jaeger's link trace information and convert it to skywalking format

Which InfluxDB version are you using? We have tested this in every PRs. No error shows up.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/7b2d91a3d7e8925794573038f971472500f4ddc8/test/e2e-v2/cases/storage/influxdb/docker-compose.yml?_pjax=%23js-repo-pjax-container%3Afirst-of-type%2C%20div%5Bitemtype%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fschema.org%2FSoftwareSourceCode%22%5D%20main%3Afirst-of-type%2C%20%5Bdata-pjax-container%5D%3Afirst-of-type#L20
Is there anyone assigned to?
About the milestone, unless there is committer proposing a time limited assignment, I prefer to keep it open. We don't want push too hard on contributions.
@kezhenxu94 I noticed you have added the event, right?
For the first part(transmits the Tracing Context to the database) I could do this in the java MySQL plugin. but for part two, @soulasuna do you have any idea who will do this?

For what you propose, we need to cover `sw8`, `sw8-x` and `sw8-correlation` as keys, even in the SQL comment. 
- https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/protocols/skywalking-cross-process-propagation-headers-protocol-v3/
- https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/protocols/skywalking-cross-process-correlation-headers-protocol-v1/

Because those are protocol definitions.
____
Meanwhile, how to put in the comment isn't a protocol level definition. But, considering this injection will effect  existing standard SQL plugins, it is better to provide a new configuration at JDBC plugin level to activate this and build this format.

> The database analyzes the Trading Context: Currently ShardingSphere is willing to participate in it and participate in the development of the plug-in.

I am not sure what does this mean. Is it going to have a ShardingSphere proxy plugin on the way?
No update for a week.

> For what you propose, we need to cover `sw8`, `sw8-x` and `sw8-correlation` as keys, even in the SQL comment.

Yes, all these keys should be covert and put into the SQL comment.

> 
> Meanwhile, how to put in the comment isn't a protocol level definition. But, considering this injection will effect existing standard SQL plugins, it is better to provide a new configuration at JDBC plugin level to activate this and build this format.

That's true. we need to create a new configuration item to activate them. I think `plugin.jdbc.is_propagating_context` is fine, it mean should we need to add the tracing context to the SQL, default is `false`.

> > The database analyzes the Trading Context: Currently ShardingSphere is willing to participate in it and participate in the development of the plug-in.
> 
> I am not sure what does this mean. Is it going to have a ShardingSphere proxy plugin on the way?

Yes, ShardingSphere proxy needs to create a plugin to analyze the context and make it as a `Span` into the Tracing Context.
Event is added. Alarm is not yet

Hi everyone, I have a question, if the original sql has a hint, will this have an impact, or will the added comment have additional parsing cost for the SQL engine? Maybe ShardingSphere proxy plugin will remove the tracing context before sending the sql to the backend database.

> if the original sql has a hint, will this have an impact, 

We will try to avoid this case.

> or will the added comment have additional parsing cost for the SQL engine? 

It changes the SQL, so from SQL string perspective, it has a little. And it costs more network bandwidth for sure.

> Maybe ShardingSphere proxy plugin will remove the tracing context before sending the sql to the backend database.

From my understanding, ShardingSphere should do. Let's see. @tristaZero

> > if the original sql has a hint, will this have an impact,
>

> 
> > or will the added comment have additional parsing cost for the SQL engine?

This would never be activated in default. A new config(default=off) will be added for this keep tracing case only

Sorry my fault. The cell phone visualization mislead me.

OK, now I can understand your proposal. But still not sure why. This kind of TLS ignore seems a security leak.

cc @apache/skywalking-committers

Sure, it's an insecure way. But skip TLS host verify is always an option for TLS client, Netty, HttpClient, [OpenTelemetry exporters][1] all support it.

In consider the secure issue, so I make this option `false` by default. One should turn it on explicitly if really want to.

[1]: https://opentelemetry.io/docs/collector/configuration/

Personally I don't like it, no matter default on or off. If you want to skip the security, HTTP proxy is there for you.(You could set up HTTP proxy between SkyWalking OAP and ElasticSearch server).

A security check is open at the server side, but client skips it because of?
I am going to wait for @kezhenxu94 @hanahmily @dmsolr @JaredTan95 or any other committers' idea.

> But skip TLS host verify is always an option for TLS client, Netty, HttpClient, OpenTelemetry exporters all support it.

I can NOT represent other open source projects' authors. I believe they have their reasons. I just don't feel right from SkyWalking's perspective. Anyway, let's wait for others' idea.
@wallezhang Thanks, please ping me if need help on this part.
Assigned, thank you.
